23/* References:
24 [1] Short Division of Long Integers, David Harvey and Paul Zimmermann,
25 Proceedings of the 20th Symposium on Computer Arithmetic (ARITH-20),
26 July 25-27, 2011, pages 7-14.
27 [2] Improved Division by Invariant Integers, Niels Möller and Torbjörn Granlund,
28 IEEE Transactions on Computers, volume 60, number 2, pages 165-175, 2011.

31#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
32#include "mpfr-impl.h"
33
34#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
35
36#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
37
38#include "invert_limb.h"
39
40/* Given u = u1*B+u0 < v = v1*B+v0 with v normalized (high bit of v1 set),
41 put in q = Q1*B+Q0 an approximation of floor(u*B^2/v), with:
42 B = 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS and q <= floor(u*B^2/v) <= q + 21.
43 Note: this function requires __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx (from invert_limb.h)
44 which is only provided so far for 64-bit limb.
45 Note: __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx can be replaced by __gmpfr_invert_limb,
46 in that case the bound 21 reduces to 16. */
47static void
48mpfr_div2_approx (mpfr_limb_ptr Q1, mpfr_limb_ptr Q0,
49 mp_limb_t u1, mp_limb_t u0,
50 mp_limb_t v1, mp_limb_t v0)
51{
52 mp_limb_t inv, q1, q0, r1, r0, cy, xx, yy;
53
54 /* first compute an approximation of q1, using a lower approximation of
55 B^2/(v1+1) - B */
56 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(v1 == MPFR_LIMB_MAX))
57 inv = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
58 else
59 __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx (inv, v1 + 1);
60 /* now inv <= B^2/(v1+1) - B */
61 umul_ppmm (q1, q0, u1, inv);
62 q1 += u1;
63 /* now q1 <= u1*B/(v1+1) < (u1*B+u0)*B/(v1*B+v0) */
64
65 /* compute q1*(v1*B+v0) into r1:r0:yy and subtract from u1:u0:0 */
66 umul_ppmm (r1, r0, q1, v1);
67 umul_ppmm (xx, yy, q1, v0);
68
69 ADD_LIMB (r0, xx, cy);
70 r1 += cy;
71
72 /* we ignore yy below, but first increment r0, to ensure we get a lower
73 approximation of the remainder */
74 r0 += yy != 0;
75 r1 += r0 == 0 && yy != 0;
76 r0 = u0 - r0;
77 r1 = u1 - r1 - (r0 > u0);
78
79 /* r1:r0 should be nonnegative */
80 MPFR_ASSERTD((r1 & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT) == 0);
81
82 /* the second quotient limb is approximated by (r1*B^2+r0*B) / v1,
83 and since (B+inv)/B approximates B/v1, this is in turn approximated
84 by (r1*B+r0)*(B+inv)/B = r1*B*r1*inv+r0+(r0*inv/B) */
85
86 q0 = r0;
87 q1 += r1;
88 /* add floor(r0*inv/B) to q0 */
89 umul_ppmm (xx, yy, r0, inv);
90 ADD_LIMB (q0, xx, cy);
91 q1 += cy;
92 MPFR_ASSERTD (r1 <= 4);
93 /* TODO: use value coverage on r1 to check that the 5 cases are tested. */
94 while (r1) /* the number of loops is at most 4 */
95 {
96 /* add inv to q0 */
97 ADD_LIMB (q0, inv, cy);
98 q1 += cy;
99 r1 --;
100 }
101
102 *Q1 = q1;
103 *Q0 = q0;
104}
105
106#endif /* GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64 */
107
108/* Special code for PREC(q) = PREC(u) = PREC(v) = p < GMP_NUMB_BITS */
109static int
110mpfr_div_1 (mpfr_ptr q, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_srcptr v, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
111{
112 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_GET_PREC(q);
113 mpfr_limb_ptr qp = MPFR_MANT(q);
114 mpfr_exp_t qx = MPFR_GET_EXP(u) - MPFR_GET_EXP(v);
115 mpfr_prec_t sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
116 mp_limb_t u0 = MPFR_MANT(u)[0];
117 mp_limb_t v0 = MPFR_MANT(v)[0];
118 mp_limb_t q0, rb, sb, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
119 int extra;
120
121 if ((extra = (u0 >= v0)))
122 u0 -= v0;
123
124#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64 /* __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx only exists for 64-bit */
125 /* First try with an approximate quotient.
126 FIXME: for p<=62 we have sh-1<2 and will never be able to round correctly.
127 Even for p=61 we have sh-1=2 and we can round correctly only when the two
128 last bist of q0 are 01, which happens with probability 25% only. */
129 {
130 mp_limb_t inv;
131 __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx (inv, v0);
132 umul_ppmm (rb, sb, u0, inv);
133 }
134 rb += u0;
135 q0 = rb >> extra;
136 /* rb does not exceed the true quotient floor(u0*2^GMP_NUMB_BITS/v0),
137 with error at most 2, which means the rational quotient q satisfies
138 rb <= q < rb + 3. We can round correctly except when the last sh-1 bits
139 of q0 are 000..000 or 111..111 or 111..110. */
140 if (MPFR_LIKELY(((q0 + 2) & (mask >> 1)) > 2))
141 {
142 rb = q0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
143 sb = 1; /* result cannot be exact in this case */
144 }
145 else /* the true quotient is rb, rb+1 or rb+2 */
146 {
147 mp_limb_t h, l;
148 q0 = rb;
149 umul_ppmm (h, l, q0, v0);
150 MPFR_ASSERTD(h < u0 || (h == u0 && l == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO));
151 /* subtract {h,l} from {u0,0} */
152 sub_ddmmss (h, l, u0, 0, h, l);
153 /* the remainder {h, l} should be < v0 */
154 /* This while loop is executed at most two times, but does not seem
155 slower than two consecutive identical if-statements. */
156 while (h || l >= v0)
157 {
158 q0 ++;
159 h -= (l < v0);
160 l -= v0;
161 }
162 MPFR_ASSERTD(h == 0 && l < v0);
163 sb = l | (q0 & extra);
164 q0 >>= extra;
165 rb = q0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
166 sb |= q0 & (mask >> 1);
167 }
168#else
169 udiv_qrnnd (q0, sb, u0, 0, v0);
170 sb |= q0 & extra;
171 q0 >>= extra;
172 rb = q0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
173 sb |= q0 & (mask >> 1);
174#endif
175
176 qp[0] = (MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | q0) & ~mask;
177 qx += extra;
178 MPFR_SIGN(q) = MPFR_MULT_SIGN (MPFR_SIGN (u), MPFR_SIGN (v));
179
180 /* rounding */
181 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx > __gmpfr_emax))
182 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
183
184 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
185 away and when q > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
186 q >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
187 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx < __gmpfr_emin))
188 {
189 /* Note: the case 0.111...111*2^(emin-1) < q < 2^(emin-1) is not possible
190 here since (up to exponent) this would imply 1 - 2^(-p) < u/v < 1,
191 thus v - 2^(-p)*v < u < v, and since we can assume 1/2 <= v < 1, it
192 would imply v - 2^(-p) = v - ulp(v) < u < v, which has no solution. */
193
194 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |q|<=2^(emin-2)
195 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
196 (a) either qx < emin - 1
197 (b) or qx = emin - 1 and qp[0] = 1000....000 and rb = sb = 0.
198 Note: in case (b), it suffices to check whether sb = 0, since rb = 1
199 and sb = 0 is not possible (the exact quotient would have p+1 bits,
200 thus u would need at least p+1 bits). */
201 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
202 (qx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (qp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && sb == 0)))
203 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
204 return mpfr_underflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
205 }
206
207 MPFR_EXP (q) = qx; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since qx might be < __gmpfr_emin
208 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
209 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
210 {
211 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
212 MPFR_RET (0);
213 }
214 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
215 {
216 /* It is not possible to have rb <> 0 and sb = 0 here, since it would
217 mean a n-bit by n-bit division gives an exact (n+1)-bit number.
218 And since the case rb = sb = 0 was already dealt with, we cannot
219 have sb = 0. Thus we cannot be in the middle of two numbers. */
220 MPFR_ASSERTD(sb != 0);
221 if (rb == 0)
222 goto truncate;
223 else
224 goto add_one_ulp;
225 }
226 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(q)))
227 {
228 truncate:
229 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
230 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(q));
231 }
232 else /* round away from zero */
233 {
234 add_one_ulp:
235 qp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
236 if (qp[0] == 0)
237 {
238 qp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
239 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
240 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
241 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
242 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
243 MPFR_SET_EXP (q, qx + 1);
244 }
245 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(q));
246 }
247}
248
249/* Special code for PREC(q) = GMP_NUMB_BITS,
250 with PREC(u), PREC(v) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS. */
251static int
252mpfr_div_1n (mpfr_ptr q, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_srcptr v, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
253{
254 mpfr_limb_ptr qp = MPFR_MANT(q);
255 mpfr_exp_t qx = MPFR_GET_EXP(u) - MPFR_GET_EXP(v);
256 mp_limb_t u0 = MPFR_MANT(u)[0];
257 mp_limb_t v0 = MPFR_MANT(v)[0];
258 mp_limb_t q0, rb, sb, l;
259 int extra;
260
261 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(q) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
262 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(u) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS);
263 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(v) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS);
264
265 if ((extra = (u0 >= v0)))
266 u0 -= v0;
267
268#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64 /* __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx only exists for 64-bit */
269 {
270 mp_limb_t inv, h;
271
272 /* First compute an approximate quotient. */
273 __gmpfr_invert_limb_approx (inv, v0);
274 umul_ppmm (rb, sb, u0, inv);
275 q0 = u0 + rb;
276 /* rb does not exceed the true quotient floor(u0*2^GMP_NUMB_BITS/v0),
277 with error at most 2, which means the rational quotient q satisfies
278 rb <= q < rb + 3, thus the true quotient is rb, rb+1 or rb+2 */
279 umul_ppmm (h, l, q0, v0);
280 MPFR_ASSERTD(h < u0 || (h == u0 && l == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO));
281 /* subtract {h,l} from {u0,0} */
282 sub_ddmmss (h, l, u0, 0, h, l);
283 /* the remainder {h, l} should be < v0 */
284 /* This while loop is executed at most two times, but does not seem
285 slower than two consecutive identical if-statements. */
286 while (h || l >= v0)
287 {
288 q0 ++;
289 h -= (l < v0);
290 l -= v0;
291 }
292 MPFR_ASSERTD(h == 0 && l < v0);
293 }
294#else
295 udiv_qrnnd (q0, l, u0, 0, v0);
296#endif
297
298 /* now (u0 - extra*v0) * 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS = q0*v0 + l with 0 <= l < v0 */
299
300 /* If extra=0, the quotient is q0, the round bit is 1 if l >= v0/2,
301 and sb are the remaining bits from l.
302 If extra=1, the quotient is MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT + (q0 >> 1), the round bit
303 is the least significant bit of q0, and sb is l. */
304
305 if (extra == 0)
306 {
307 qp[0] = q0;
308 /* If "l + l < l", then there is a carry in l + l, thus 2*l > v0.
309 Otherwise if there is no carry, we check whether 2*l >= v0. */
310 rb = (l + l < l) || (l + l >= v0);
311 sb = (rb) ? l + l - v0 : l;
312 }
313 else
314 {
315 qp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (q0 >> 1);
316 rb = q0 & MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
317 sb = l;
318 qx ++;
319 }
320
321 MPFR_SIGN(q) = MPFR_MULT_SIGN (MPFR_SIGN (u), MPFR_SIGN (v));
322
323 /* rounding */
324 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx > __gmpfr_emax))
325 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
326
327 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
328 away and when q > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
329 q >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
330 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx < __gmpfr_emin))
331 {
332 /* Note: the case 0.111...111*2^(emin-1) < q < 2^(emin-1) is not possible
333 here since (up to exponent) this would imply 1 - 2^(-p) < u/v < 1,
334 thus v - 2^(-p)*v < u < v, and since we can assume 1/2 <= v < 1, it
335 would imply v - 2^(-p) = v - ulp(v) < u < v, which has no solution. */
336
337 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |q|<=2^(emin-2)
338 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
339 (a) either qx < emin - 1
340 (b) or qx = emin - 1 and qp[0] = 1000....000 and rb = sb = 0.
341 Note: in case (b), it suffices to check whether sb = 0, since rb = 1
342 and sb = 0 is not possible (the exact quotient would have p+1 bits,
343 thus u would need at least p+1 bits). */
344 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
345 (qx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (qp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && sb == 0)))
346 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
347 return mpfr_underflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
348 }
349
350 MPFR_EXP (q) = qx; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since qx might be < __gmpfr_emin
351 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
352 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
353 {
354 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
355 MPFR_RET (0);
356 }
357 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
358 {
359 /* It is not possible to have rb <> 0 and sb = 0 here, since it would
360 mean a n-bit by n-bit division gives an exact (n+1)-bit number.
361 And since the case rb = sb = 0 was already dealt with, we cannot
362 have sb = 0. Thus we cannot be in the middle of two numbers. */
363 MPFR_ASSERTD(sb != 0);
364 if (rb == 0)
365 goto truncate;
366 else
367 goto add_one_ulp;
368 }
369 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(q)))
370 {
371 truncate:
372 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
373 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(q));
374 }
375 else /* round away from zero */
376 {
377 add_one_ulp:
378 qp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
379 if (qp[0] == 0)
380 {
381 qp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
382 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
383 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
384 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
385 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
386 MPFR_SET_EXP (q, qx + 1);
387 }
388 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(q));
389 }
390}
391
392/* Special code for GMP_NUMB_BITS < PREC(q) < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS and
393 PREC(u) = PREC(v) = PREC(q) */
394static int
395mpfr_div_2 (mpfr_ptr q, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_srcptr v, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
396{
397 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_GET_PREC(q);
398 mpfr_limb_ptr qp = MPFR_MANT(q);
399 mpfr_exp_t qx = MPFR_GET_EXP(u) - MPFR_GET_EXP(v);
400 mpfr_prec_t sh = 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
401 mp_limb_t h, rb, sb, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
402 mp_limb_t v1 = MPFR_MANT(v)[1], v0 = MPFR_MANT(v)[0];
403 mp_limb_t q1, q0, r3, r2, r1, r0, l, t;
404 int extra;
405
406 r3 = MPFR_MANT(u)[1];
407 r2 = MPFR_MANT(u)[0];
408 extra = r3 > v1 || (r3 == v1 && r2 >= v0);
409 if (extra)
410 sub_ddmmss (r3, r2, r3, r2, v1, v0);
411
412 MPFR_ASSERTD(r3 < v1 || (r3 == v1 && r2 < v0));
413
414#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
415 mpfr_div2_approx (&q1, &q0, r3, r2, v1, v0);
416 /* we know q1*B+q0 is smaller or equal to the exact quotient, with
417 difference at most 21 */
418 if (MPFR_LIKELY(((q0 + 21) & (mask >> 1)) > 21))
419 sb = 1; /* result is not exact when we can round with an approximation */
420 else
421 {
422 /* we know q1:q0 is a good-enough approximation, use it! */
423 mp_limb_t s0, s1, s2, h, l;
424
425 /* Since we know the difference should be at most 21*(v1:v0) after the
426 subtraction below, thus at most 21*2^128, it suffices to compute the
427 lower 3 limbs of (q1:q0) * (v1:v0). */
428 umul_ppmm (s1, s0, q0, v0);
429 umul_ppmm (s2, l, q0, v1);
430 s1 += l;
431 s2 += (s1 < l);
432 umul_ppmm (h, l, q1, v0);
433 s1 += l;
434 s2 += h + (s1 < l);
435 s2 += q1 * v1;
436 /* Subtract s2:s1:s0 from r2:0:0, with result in s2:s1:s0. */
437 s2 = r2 - s2;
438 /* now negate s1:s0 */
439 s0 = -s0;
440 s1 = -s1 - (s0 != 0);
441 /* there is a borrow in s2 when s0 and s1 are not both zero */
442 s2 -= (s1 != 0 || s0 != 0);
443 while (s2 > 0 || (s1 > v1) || (s1 == v1 && s0 >= v0))
444 {
445 /* add 1 to q1:q0 */
446 q0 ++;
447 q1 += (q0 == 0);
448 /* subtract v1:v0 to s2:s1:s0 */
449 s2 -= (s1 < v1) || (s1 == v1 && s0 < v0);
450 sub_ddmmss (s1, s0, s1, s0, v1, v0);
451 }
452 sb = s1 | s0;
453 }
454 goto round_div2;
455#endif
456
457 /* now r3:r2 < v1:v0 */
458 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(r3 == v1)) /* can occur in some rare cases */
459 {
460 /* This can only occur in case extra=0, since otherwise we would have
461 u_old >= u_new + v >= B^2/2 + B^2/2 = B^2. In this case we have
462 r3 = u1 and r2 = u0, thus the remainder u*B-q1*v is
463 v1*B^2+u0*B-(B-1)*(v1*B+v0) = (u0-v0+v1)*B+v0.
464 Warning: in this case q1 = B-1 can be too large, for example with
465 u = B^2/2 and v = B^2/2 + B - 1, then u*B-(B-1)*u = -1/2*B^2+2*B-1. */
466 MPFR_ASSERTD(extra == 0);
467 q1 = MPFR_LIMB_MAX;
468 r1 = v0;
469 t = v0 - r2; /* t > 0 since r3:r2 < v1:v0 */
470 r2 = v1 - t;
471 if (t > v1) /* q1 = B-1 is too large, we need q1 = B-2, which is ok
472 since u*B - q1*v >= v1*B^2-(B-2)*(v1*B+B-1) =
473 -B^2 + 2*B*v1 + 3*B - 2 >= 0 since v1>=B/2 and B>=2 */
474 {
475 q1 --;
476 /* add v to r2:r1 */
477 r1 += v0;
478 r2 += v1 + (r1 < v0);
479 }
480 }
481 else
482 {
483 /* divide r3:r2 by v1: requires r3 < v1 */
484 udiv_qrnnd (q1, r2, r3, r2, v1);
485 /* u-extra*v = q1 * v1 + r2 */
486
487 /* now subtract q1*v0 to r2:0 */
488 umul_ppmm (h, l, q1, v0);
489 t = r2; /* save old value of r2 */
490 r1 = -l;
491 r2 -= h + (l != 0);
492 /* Note: h + (l != 0) < 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS. */
493
494 /* we have r2:r1 = oldr2:0 - q1*v0 mod 2^(2*GMP_NUMB_BITS)
495 thus (u-extra*v)*B = q1 * v + r2:r1 mod 2^(2*GMP_NUMB_BITS) */
496
497 /* this while loop should be run at most twice */
498 while (r2 > t) /* borrow when subtracting h + (l != 0), q1 too large */
499 {
500 q1 --;
501 /* add v1:v0 to r2:r1 */
502 t = r2;
503 r1 += v0;
504 r2 += v1 + (r1 < v0);
505 /* note: since 2^(GMP_NUMB_BITS-1) <= v1 + (r1 < v0)
506 <= 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS, it suffices to check if r2 <= t to see
507 if there was a carry or not. */
508 }
509 }
510
511 /* now (u-extra*v)*B = q1 * v + r2:r1 with 0 <= r2:r1 < v */
512
513 MPFR_ASSERTD(r2 < v1 || (r2 == v1 && r1 < v0));
514
515 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(r2 == v1))
516 {
517 q0 = MPFR_LIMB_MAX;
518 /* r2:r1:0 - q0*(v1:v0) = v1:r1:0 - (B-1)*(v1:v0)
519 = r1:0 - v0:0 + v1:v0 */
520 r0 = v0;
521 t = v0 - r1; /* t > 0 since r2:r1 < v1:v0 */
522 r1 = v1 - t;
523 if (t > v1)
524 {
525 q0 --;
526 /* add v to r1:r0 */
527 r0 += v0;
528 r1 += v1 + (r0 < v0);
529 }
530 }
531 else
532 {
533 /* divide r2:r1 by v1: requires r2 < v1 */
534 udiv_qrnnd (q0, r1, r2, r1, v1);
535
536 /* r2:r1 = q0*v1 + r1 */
537
538 /* subtract q0*v0 to r1:0 */
539 umul_ppmm (h, l, q0, v0);
540 t = r1;
541 r0 = -l;
542 r1 -= h + (l != 0);
543
544 /* this while loop should be run at most twice */
545 while (r1 > t) /* borrow when subtracting h + (l != 0),
546 q0 was too large */
547 {
548 q0 --;
549 /* add v1:v0 to r1:r0 */
550 t = r1;
551 r0 += v0;
552 r1 += v1 + (r0 < v0);
553 /* note: since 2^(GMP_NUMB_BITS-1) <= v1 + (r0 < v0)
554 <= 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS, it suffices to check if r1 <= t to see
555 if there was a carry or not. */
556 }
557 }
558
559 MPFR_ASSERTD(r1 < v1 || (r1 == v1 && r0 < v0));
560
561 /* now (u-extra*v)*B^2 = (q1:q0) * v + r1:r0 */
562
563 sb = r1 | r0;
564
565 /* here, q1:q0 should be an approximation of the quotient (or the exact
566 quotient), and sb the sticky bit */
567
568#if GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
569 round_div2:
570#endif
571 if (extra)
572 {
573 qx ++;
574 sb |= q0 & 1;
575 q0 = (q1 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (q0 >> 1);
576 q1 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (q1 >> 1);
577 }
578 rb = q0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
579 sb |= (q0 & mask) ^ rb;
580 qp[1] = q1;
581 qp[0] = q0 & ~mask;
582
583 MPFR_SIGN(q) = MPFR_MULT_SIGN (MPFR_SIGN (u), MPFR_SIGN (v));
584
585 /* rounding */
586 if (qx > __gmpfr_emax)
587 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
588
589 /* Warning: underflow should be checked *after* rounding, thus when rounding
590 away and when q > 0.111...111*2^(emin-1), or when rounding to nearest and
591 q >= 0.111...111[1]*2^(emin-1), there is no underflow. */
592 if (qx < __gmpfr_emin)
593 {
594 /* Note: the case 0.111...111*2^(emin-1) < q < 2^(emin-1) is not possible
595 here since (up to exponent) this would imply 1 - 2^(-p) < u/v < 1,
596 thus v - 2^(-p)*v < u < v, and since we can assume 1/2 <= v < 1, it
597 would imply v - 2^(-p) = v - ulp(v) < u < v, which has no solution. */
598
599 /* For RNDN, mpfr_underflow always rounds away, thus for |q|<=2^(emin-2)
600 we have to change to RNDZ. This corresponds to:
601 (a) either qx < emin - 1
602 (b) or qx = emin - 1 and qp[1] = 100....000, qp[0] = 0 and rb = sb = 0.
603 Note: in case (b), it suffices to check whether sb = 0, since rb = 1
604 and sb = 0 is not possible (the exact quotient would have p+1 bits, thus
605 u would need at least p+1 bits). */
606 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN &&
607 (qx < __gmpfr_emin - 1 ||
608 (qp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && qp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && sb == 0)))
609 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
610 return mpfr_underflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
611 }
612
613 MPFR_EXP (q) = qx; /* Don't use MPFR_SET_EXP since qx might be < __gmpfr_emin
614 in the cases "goto rounding" above. */
615 if ((rb == 0 && sb == 0) || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
616 {
617 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
618 MPFR_RET (0);
619 }
620 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
621 {
622 /* See the comment in mpfr_div_1. */
623 MPFR_ASSERTD(sb != 0);
624 if (rb == 0)
625 goto truncate;
626 else
627 goto add_one_ulp;
628 }
629 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, MPFR_IS_NEG(q)))
630 {
631 truncate:
632 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx >= __gmpfr_emin);
633 MPFR_RET(-MPFR_SIGN(q));
634 }
635 else /* round away from zero */
636 {
637 add_one_ulp:
638 qp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
639 qp[1] += (qp[0] == 0);
640 if (qp[1] == 0)
641 {
642 qp[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
643 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qx + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
644 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
645 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
646 MPFR_ASSERTD(qx + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
647 MPFR_SET_EXP (q, qx + 1);
648 }
649 MPFR_RET(MPFR_SIGN(q));
650 }
651}
652
653#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) */
654
655/* check if {ap, an} is zero */
656static int
657mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (mpfr_limb_ptr ap, mp_size_t an)
658{
659 MPFR_ASSERTD (an >= 0);
660 while (an > 0)
661 if (MPFR_LIKELY(ap[--an] != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO))
662 return 1;
663 return 0;
664}
665
666/* compare {ap, an} and {bp, bn} >> extra,
667 aligned by the more significant limbs.
668 Takes into account bp[0] for extra=1.
669*/
670static int
671mpfr_mpn_cmp_aux (mpfr_limb_ptr ap, mp_size_t an,
672 mpfr_limb_ptr bp, mp_size_t bn, int extra)
673{
674 int cmp = 0;
675 mp_size_t k;
676 mp_limb_t bb;
677
678 MPFR_ASSERTD (an >= 0);
679 MPFR_ASSERTD (bn >= 0);
680 MPFR_ASSERTD (extra == 0 || extra == 1);
681
682 if (an >= bn)
683 {
684 k = an - bn;
685 while (cmp == 0 && bn > 0)
686 {
687 bn --;
688 bb = (extra) ? ((bp[bn+1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (bp[bn] >> 1))
689 : bp[bn];
690 cmp = (ap[k + bn] > bb) ? 1 : ((ap[k + bn] < bb) ? -1 : 0);
691 }
692 bb = (extra) ? bp[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1) : MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
693 while (cmp == 0 && k > 0)
694 {
695 k--;
696 cmp = (ap[k] > bb) ? 1 : ((ap[k] < bb) ? -1 : 0);
697 bb = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO; /* ensure we consider only once bp[0] & 1 */
698 }
699 if (cmp == 0 && bb != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
700 cmp = -1;
701 }
702 else /* an < bn */
703 {
704 k = bn - an;
705 while (cmp == 0 && an > 0)
706 {
707 an --;
708 bb = (extra) ? ((bp[k+an+1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (bp[k+an] >> 1))
709 : bp[k+an];
710 if (ap[an] > bb)
711 cmp = 1;
712 else if (ap[an] < bb)
713 cmp = -1;
714 }
715 while (cmp == 0 && k > 0)
716 {
717 k--;
718 bb = (extra) ? ((bp[k+1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (bp[k] >> 1))
719 : bp[k];
720 cmp = (bb != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) ? -1 : 0;
721 }
722 if (cmp == 0 && extra && (bp[0] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE))
723 cmp = -1;
724 }
725 return cmp;
726}
727
728/* {ap, n} <- {ap, n} - {bp, n} >> extra - cy, with cy = 0 or 1.
729 Return borrow out.
730*/
731static mp_limb_t
732mpfr_mpn_sub_aux (mpfr_limb_ptr ap, mpfr_limb_ptr bp, mp_size_t n,
733 mp_limb_t cy, int extra)
734{
735 mp_limb_t bb, rp;
736
737 MPFR_ASSERTD (cy <= 1);
738 MPFR_ASSERTD (n >= 0);
739
740 while (n--)
741 {
742 bb = (extra) ? ((bp[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS-1)) | (bp[0] >> 1)) : bp[0];
743 rp = ap[0] - bb - cy;
744 cy = (ap[0] < bb) || (cy && ~rp == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) ?
745 MPFR_LIMB_ONE : MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
746 ap[0] = rp;
747 ap ++;
748 bp ++;
749 }
750 MPFR_ASSERTD (cy <= 1);
751 return cy;
752}
753
754/* For large precision, mpz_tdiv_q (which computes only quotient)
755 is faster than mpn_divrem (which computes also the remainder).
756 Unfortunately as of GMP 6.0.0 the corresponding mpn_div_q function
757 is not in the public interface, thus we call mpz_tdiv_q.
758
759 If this function succeeds in computing the correct rounding, return 1,
760 and put the ternary value in inex.
761
762 Otherwise return 0 (and inex is undefined).
763*/
764static int
765mpfr_div_with_mpz_tdiv_q (mpfr_ptr q, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_srcptr v,
766 mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode, int *inex)
767{
768 mpz_t qm, um, vm;
769 mpfr_exp_t ue, ve;
770 mpfr_prec_t qp = MPFR_PREC(q), wp = qp + GMP_NUMB_BITS;
771 mp_size_t up, vp, k;
772 int ok;
773
774 mpz_init (qm);
775 mpz_init (um);
776 mpz_init (vm);
777
778 ue = mpfr_get_z_2exp (um, u); /* u = um * 2^ue */
779 ve = mpfr_get_z_2exp (vm, v); /* v = vm * 2^ve */
780
781 vp = mpz_sizeinbase (vm, 2);
782 if (vp > wp)
783 {
784 k = vp - wp; /* truncate k bits of vm */
785 mpz_tdiv_q_2exp (vm, vm, k);
786 ve += k;
787 vp -= k;
788 }
789
790 /* we want about qp + GMP_NUMB_BITS bits of the quotient, thus um should
791 have qp + GMP_NUMB_BITS more bits than vm */
792
793 up = mpz_sizeinbase (um, 2);
794 if (up > vp + wp)
795 {
796 k = up - (vp + wp); /* truncate k bits of um */
797 mpz_tdiv_q_2exp (um, um, k);
798 ue += k;
799 up -= k;
800 }
801 else if (up < vp + wp) /* we need more bits */
802 {
803 k = (vp + wp) - up;
804 mpz_mul_2exp (um, um, k);
805 ue -= k;
806 up += k;
807 }
808
809 /* now um has exactly wp more bits than vp */
810 mpz_tdiv_q (qm, um, vm);
811 /* qm has either wp or wp+1 bits, and we have:
812 (a) um = u/2^ue*(1-tu) with tu=0 if no truncation of um,
813 and 0 <= tu < 2^(1-wp) otherwise;
814 (b) vm = v/2^ve*(1-tv) with tv=0 if no truncation of vm,
815 and 0 <= tv < 2^(1-wp) otherwise;
816 (c) um/vm - 1 < qm <= um/vm, thus qm = um/vm*(1-tq) with
817 0 <= tw < 2^(1-wp) since um/vm >= 2^(wp-1)
818 Altogether we have:
819 q = u/v*2^(ve-ue)*(1-tu)/(1-tv)*(1-tq)
820 Thus:
821 u/v*2^(ve-ue)*(1-2^(2-wp)) < q < u/v*2^(ve-ue)*(1+2^(2-wp)).
822 If q has wp bits, the error is less than 2^(wp-1)*2^(2-wp) <= 2.
823 If q has wp+1 bits, the error is less than 2^wp*2^(2-wp) <= 4.
824 */
825
826 k = mpz_sizeinbase (qm, 2) - wp; /* 0 or 1 */
827 /* Assume qm has wp bits (i.e. k=0) and a directed rounding: if the first
828 set bit after position 1 has position less than GMP_NUMB_BITS, then
829 subtracting 2 to qm will not change the bits beyond the GMP_NUMB_BITS
830 low ones, thus we get correct rounding.
831 For k=1, we need to start at position 2, and the first set bit has to be
832 in posiiton less than GMP_NUMB_BITS+1.
833 For rounding to nearest, the first set bit has to be in position less
834 than GMP_NUMB_BITS-1 for k=0 (or less than GMP_NUMB_BITS for k=1).
835 */
836 if (mpz_scan1 (qm, k + 1) < GMP_NUMB_BITS + k - (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) &&
837 mpz_scan0 (qm, k + 1) < GMP_NUMB_BITS + k - (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))
838 {
839 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
840 ok = 1;
841 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
842 *inex = mpfr_set_z (q, qm, rnd_mode);
843 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
844 /* if we got an underflow or overflow, the result is not valid */
845 if (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(q) || MPFR_EXP(q) == MPFR_EXT_EMIN ||
846 MPFR_EXP(q) == MPFR_EXT_EMAX)
847 ok = 0;
848 MPFR_EXP(q) += ue - ve;
849 *inex = mpfr_check_range (q, *inex, rnd_mode);
850 }
851 else
852 ok = 0;
853
854 mpz_clear (qm);
855 mpz_clear (um);
856 mpz_clear (vm);
857
858 return ok;
859}
860
861MPFR_HOT_FUNCTION_ATTR int
862mpfr_div (mpfr_ptr q, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_srcptr v, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
863{
864 mp_size_t q0size, usize, vsize;
865 mp_size_t qsize; /* number of limbs wanted for the computed quotient */
866 mp_size_t qqsize;
867 mp_size_t k;
868 mpfr_limb_ptr q0p, qp;
869 mpfr_limb_ptr up, vp;
870 mpfr_limb_ptr ap;
871 mpfr_limb_ptr bp;
872 mp_limb_t qh;
873 mp_limb_t sticky_u, sticky_v;
874 mp_limb_t low_u;
875 mp_limb_t sticky;
876 mp_limb_t sticky3;
877 mp_limb_t round_bit;
878 mpfr_exp_t qexp;
879 int sign_quotient;
880 int extra_bit;
881 int sh, sh2;
882 int inex;
883 int like_rndz;
884 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
885
886 MPFR_LOG_FUNC (
887 ("u[%Pu]=%.*Rg v[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d",
888 mpfr_get_prec(u), mpfr_log_prec, u,
889 mpfr_get_prec (v),mpfr_log_prec, v, rnd_mode),
890 ("q[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d", mpfr_get_prec(q), mpfr_log_prec, q, inex));
891
892 /**************************************************************************
893 * *
894 * This part of the code deals with special cases *
895 * *
896 **************************************************************************/
897
898 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_ARE_SINGULAR(u,v)))
899 {
900 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(u) || MPFR_IS_NAN(v))
901 {
902 MPFR_SET_NAN(q);
903 MPFR_RET_NAN;
904 }
905 sign_quotient = MPFR_MULT_SIGN( MPFR_SIGN(u) , MPFR_SIGN(v) );
906 MPFR_SET_SIGN(q, sign_quotient);
907 if (MPFR_IS_INF(u))
908 {
909 if (MPFR_IS_INF(v))
910 {
911 MPFR_SET_NAN(q);
912 MPFR_RET_NAN;
913 }
914 else
915 {
916 MPFR_SET_INF(q);
917 MPFR_RET(0);
918 }
919 }
920 else if (MPFR_IS_INF(v))
921 {
922 MPFR_SET_ZERO (q);
923 MPFR_RET (0);
924 }
925 else if (MPFR_IS_ZERO (v))
926 {
927 if (MPFR_IS_ZERO (u))
928 {
929 MPFR_SET_NAN(q);
930 MPFR_RET_NAN;
931 }
932 else
933 {
934 MPFR_ASSERTD (! MPFR_IS_INF (u));
935 MPFR_SET_INF(q);
936 MPFR_SET_DIVBY0 ();
937 MPFR_RET(0);
938 }
939 }
940 else
941 {
942 MPFR_ASSERTD (MPFR_IS_ZERO (u));
943 MPFR_SET_ZERO (q);
944 MPFR_RET (0);
945 }
946 }
947
948 /* When MPFR_GENERIC_ABI is defined, we don't use special code. */
949#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI)
950 if (MPFR_GET_PREC(u) == MPFR_GET_PREC(q) &&
951 MPFR_GET_PREC(v) == MPFR_GET_PREC(q))
952 {
953 if (MPFR_GET_PREC(q) < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
954 return mpfr_div_1 (q, u, v, rnd_mode);
955
956 if (GMP_NUMB_BITS < MPFR_GET_PREC(q) &&
957 MPFR_GET_PREC(q) < 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS)
958 return mpfr_div_2 (q, u, v, rnd_mode);
959
960 if (MPFR_GET_PREC(q) == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
961 return mpfr_div_1n (q, u, v, rnd_mode);
962 }
963#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) */
964
965 usize = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(u);
966 vsize = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(v);
967 q0size = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(q); /* number of limbs of destination */
968 q0p = MPFR_MANT(q);
969 up = MPFR_MANT(u);
970 vp = MPFR_MANT(v);
971 sticky_u = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
972 sticky_v = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
973 round_bit = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
974
975 /**************************************************************************
976 * *
977 * End of the part concerning special values. *
978 * *
979 **************************************************************************/
980
981 /* when the divisor has one limb, we can use mpfr_div_ui, which should be
982 faster, assuming there is no intermediate overflow or underflow.
983 The divisor interpreted as an integer satisfies
984 2^(GMP_NUMB_BITS-1) <= vm < 2^GMP_NUMB_BITS, thus the quotient
985 satisfies 2^(EXP(u)-1-GMP_NUMB_BITS) < u/vm < 2^(EXP(u)-GMP_NUMB_BITS+1)
986 and its exponent is either EXP(u)-GMP_NUMB_BITS or one more. */
987 if (vsize <= 1 && __gmpfr_emin <= MPFR_EXP(u) - GMP_NUMB_BITS
988 && MPFR_EXP(u) - GMP_NUMB_BITS + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax
989 && vp[0] <= ULONG_MAX)
990 {
991 mpfr_exp_t exp_v = MPFR_EXP(v); /* save it in case q=v */
992 if (MPFR_IS_POS (v))
993 inex = mpfr_div_ui (q, u, vp[0], rnd_mode);
994 else
995 {
996 inex = -mpfr_div_ui (q, u, vp[0], MPFR_INVERT_RND(rnd_mode));
997 MPFR_CHANGE_SIGN(q);
998 }
999 /* q did not under/overflow */
1000 MPFR_EXP(q) -= exp_v;
1001 /* The following test is needed, otherwise the next addition
1002 on the exponent may overflow, e.g. when dividing the
1003 largest finite MPFR number by the smallest positive one. */
1004 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_EXP(q) > __gmpfr_emax - GMP_NUMB_BITS))
1005 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, MPFR_SIGN(q));
1006 MPFR_EXP(q) += GMP_NUMB_BITS;
1007 return mpfr_check_range (q, inex, rnd_mode);
1008 }
1009
1010 /* for large precisions, try using truncated division first */
1011 if (q0size >= 32 && mpfr_div_with_mpz_tdiv_q (q, u, v, rnd_mode, &inex))
1012 return inex;
1013
1014 MPFR_TMP_MARK(marker);
1015
1016 /* set sign */
1017 sign_quotient = MPFR_MULT_SIGN( MPFR_SIGN(u) , MPFR_SIGN(v) );
1018 MPFR_SET_SIGN(q, sign_quotient);
1019
1020 /* determine if an extra bit comes from the division, i.e. if the
1021 significand of u (as a fraction in [1/2, 1[) is larger than that
1022 of v */
1023 if (MPFR_LIKELY(up[usize - 1] != vp[vsize - 1]))
1024 extra_bit = (up[usize - 1] > vp[vsize - 1]) ? 1 : 0;
1025 else /* most significant limbs are equal, must look at further limbs */
1026 {
1027 mp_size_t l;
1028
1029 k = usize - 1;
1030 l = vsize - 1;
1031 while (k != 0 && l != 0 && up[--k] == vp[--l]);
1032 /* now k=0 or l=0 or up[k] != vp[l] */
1033 if (up[k] != vp[l])
1034 extra_bit = (up[k] > vp[l]);
1035 /* now up[k] = vp[l], thus either k=0 or l=0 */
1036 else if (l == 0) /* no more divisor limb */
1037 extra_bit = 1;
1038 else /* k=0: no more dividend limb */
1039 extra_bit = mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (vp, l) == 0;
1040 }
1041
1042 /* set exponent */
1043 qexp = MPFR_GET_EXP (u) - MPFR_GET_EXP (v) + extra_bit;
1044
1045 /* sh is the number of zero bits in the low limb of the quotient */
1046 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO(sh, MPFR_PREC(q));
1047
1048 like_rndz = rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ ||
1049 rnd_mode == (sign_quotient < 0 ? MPFR_RNDU : MPFR_RNDD);
1050
1051 /**************************************************************************
1052 * *
1053 * We first try Mulders' short division (for large operands) *
1054 * *
1055 **************************************************************************/
1056
1057 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(q0size >= MPFR_DIV_THRESHOLD &&
1058 vsize >= MPFR_DIV_THRESHOLD))
1059 {
1060 mp_size_t n = q0size + 1; /* we will perform a short (2n)/n division */
1061 mpfr_limb_ptr ap, bp, qp;
1062 mpfr_prec_t p;
1063
1064 /* since Mulders' short division clobbers the dividend, we have to
1065 copy it */
1066 ap = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n + n);
1067 if (usize >= n + n) /* truncate the dividend */
1068 MPN_COPY(ap, up + usize - (n + n), n + n);
1069 else /* zero-pad the dividend */
1070 {
1071 MPN_COPY(ap + (n + n) - usize, up, usize);
1072 MPN_ZERO(ap, (n + n) - usize);
1073 }
1074
1075 if (vsize >= n) /* truncate the divisor */
1076 bp = vp + vsize - n;
1077 else /* zero-pad the divisor */
1078 {
1079 bp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
1080 MPN_COPY(bp + n - vsize, vp, vsize);
1081 MPN_ZERO(bp, n - vsize);
1082 }
1083
1084 qp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (n);
1085 qh = mpfr_divhigh_n (qp, ap, bp, n);
1086 MPFR_ASSERTD (qh == 0 || qh == 1);
1087 /* in all cases, the error is at most (2n+2) ulps on qh*B^n+{qp,n},
1088 cf algorithms.tex */
1089
1090 p = n * GMP_NUMB_BITS - MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (2 * n + 2);
1091 /* If rnd=RNDN, we need to be able to round with a directed rounding
1092 and one more bit. */
1093 if (qh == 1)
1094 {
1095 mpn_rshift (qp, qp, n, 1);
1096 qp[n - 1] |= MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1097 }
1098 if (MPFR_LIKELY (mpfr_round_p (qp, n, p,
1099 MPFR_PREC(q) + (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))))
1100 {
1101 /* we can round correctly whatever the rounding mode */
1102 MPN_COPY (q0p, qp + 1, q0size);
1103 q0p[0] &= ~MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh); /* put to zero low sh bits */
1104
1105 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) /* round to nearest */
1106 {
1107 /* we know we can round, thus we are never in the even rule case:
1108 if the round bit is 0, we truncate
1109 if the round bit is 1, we add 1 */
1110 if (sh > 0)
1111 round_bit = (qp[1] >> (sh - 1)) & 1;
1112 else
1113 round_bit = qp[0] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1);
1114 /* TODO: add value coverage tests in tdiv to check that
1115 we reach this part with different values of qh and
1116 round_bit (4 cases). */
1117 if (round_bit == 0)
1118 {
1119 inex = -1;
1120 goto truncate;
1121 }
1122 else /* round_bit = 1 */
1123 goto add_one_ulp;
1124 }
1125 else if (! like_rndz) /* round away */
1126 goto add_one_ulp;
1127 else /* round to zero: nothing to do */
1128 {
1129 inex = -1;
1130 goto truncate;
1131 }
1132 }
1133 }
1134
1135 /**************************************************************************
1136 * *
1137 * Mulders' short division failed: we revert to integer division *
1138 * *
1139 **************************************************************************/
1140
1141 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && sh == 0))
1142 { /* we compute the quotient with one more limb, in order to get
1143 the round bit in the quotient, and the remainder only contains
1144 sticky bits */
1145 qsize = q0size + 1;
1146 /* need to allocate memory for the quotient */
1147 qp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (qsize);
1148 }
1149 else
1150 {
1151 qsize = q0size;
1152 qp = q0p; /* directly put the quotient in the destination */
1153 }
1154 qqsize = qsize + qsize;
1155
1156 /* prepare the dividend */
1157 ap = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (qqsize);
1158 if (MPFR_LIKELY(qqsize > usize)) /* use the full dividend */
1159 {
1160 k = qqsize - usize; /* k > 0 */
1161 MPN_ZERO(ap, k);
1162 if (extra_bit)
1163 ap[k - 1] = mpn_rshift (ap + k, up, usize, 1);
1164 else
1165 MPN_COPY(ap + k, up, usize);
1166 }
1167 else /* truncate the dividend */
1168 {
1169 k = usize - qqsize;
1170 if (extra_bit)
1171 sticky_u = mpn_rshift (ap, up + k, qqsize, 1);
1172 else
1173 MPN_COPY(ap, up + k, qqsize);
1174 sticky_u = sticky_u || mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (up, k);
1175 }
1176 low_u = sticky_u;
1177
1178 /* now sticky_u is non-zero iff the truncated part of u is non-zero */
1179
1180 /* prepare the divisor */
1181 if (MPFR_LIKELY(vsize >= qsize))
1182 {
1183 k = vsize - qsize;
1184 if (qp != vp)
1185 bp = vp + k; /* avoid copying the divisor */
1186 else /* need to copy, since mpn_divrem doesn't allow overlap
1187 between quotient and divisor, necessarily k = 0
1188 since quotient and divisor are the same mpfr variable */
1189 {
1190 bp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (qsize);
1191 MPN_COPY(bp, vp, vsize);
1192 }
1193 sticky_v = sticky_v || mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (vp, k);
1194 k = 0;
1195 }
1196 else /* vsize < qsize: small divisor case */
1197 {
1198 bp = vp;
1199 k = qsize - vsize;
1200 }
1201
1202 /**************************************************************************
1203 * *
1204 * Here we perform the real division of {ap+k,qqsize-k} by {bp,qsize-k} *
1205 * *
1206 **************************************************************************/
1207
1208 /* if Mulders' short division failed, we revert to division with remainder */
1209 qh = mpn_divrem (qp, 0, ap + k, qqsize - k, bp, qsize - k);
1210 /* warning: qh may be 1 if u1 == v1, but u < v */
1211
1212 k = qsize;
1213 sticky_u = sticky_u || mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (ap, k);
1214
1215 sticky = sticky_u | sticky_v;
1216
1217 /* now sticky is non-zero iff one of the following holds:
1218 (a) the truncated part of u is non-zero
1219 (b) the truncated part of v is non-zero
1220 (c) the remainder from division is non-zero */
1221
1222 if (MPFR_LIKELY(qsize == q0size))
1223 {
1224 sticky3 = qp[0] & MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh); /* does nothing when sh=0 */
1225 sh2 = sh;
1226 }
1227 else /* qsize = q0size + 1: only happens when rnd_mode=MPFR_RNDN and sh=0 */
1228 {
1229 MPN_COPY (q0p, qp + 1, q0size);
1230 sticky3 = qp[0];
1231 sh2 = GMP_NUMB_BITS;
1232 }
1233 qp[0] ^= sticky3;
1234 /* sticky3 contains the truncated bits from the quotient,
1235 including the round bit, and 1 <= sh2 <= GMP_NUMB_BITS
1236 is the number of bits in sticky3 */
1237 inex = (sticky != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) || (sticky3 != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO);
1238
1239 /* to round, we distinguish two cases:
1240 (a) vsize <= qsize: we used the full divisor
1241 (b) vsize > qsize: the divisor was truncated
1242 */
1243
1244 if (MPFR_LIKELY(vsize <= qsize)) /* use the full divisor */
1245 {
1246 if (MPFR_LIKELY(rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))
1247 {
1248 round_bit = sticky3 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh2 - 1));
1249 sticky = (sticky3 ^ round_bit) | sticky_u;
1250 }
1251 else if (like_rndz || inex == 0)
1252 sticky = (inex == 0) ? MPFR_LIMB_ZERO : MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
1253 else /* round away from zero */
1254 sticky = MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
1255 goto case_1;
1256 }
1257 else /* vsize > qsize: need to truncate the divisor */
1258 {
1259 if (inex == 0)
1260 goto truncate;
1261 else
1262 {
1263 /* We know the estimated quotient is an upper bound of the exact
1264 quotient (with rounding toward zero), with a difference of at
1265 most 2 in qp[0].
1266 Thus we can round except when sticky3 is 000...000 or 000...001
1267 for directed rounding, and 100...000 or 100...001 for rounding
1268 to nearest. (For rounding to nearest, we cannot determine the
1269 inexact flag for 000...000 or 000...001.)
1270 */
1271 mp_limb_t sticky3orig = sticky3;
1272 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
1273 {
1274 round_bit = sticky3 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh2 - 1));
1275 sticky3 = sticky3 ^ round_bit;
1276 }
1277 if (sticky3 != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && sticky3 != MPFR_LIMB_ONE)
1278 {
1279 sticky = sticky3;
1280 goto case_1;
1281 }
1282 else /* hard case: we have to compare q1 * v0 and r + low(u),
1283 where q1 * v0 has qsize + (vsize-qsize) = vsize limbs, and
1284 r + low(u) has qsize + (usize-2*qsize) = usize-qsize limbs */
1285 {
1286 mp_size_t l;
1287 mpfr_limb_ptr sp;
1288 int cmp_s_r;
1289 mp_limb_t qh2;
1290
1291 sp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (vsize);
1292 k = vsize - qsize;
1293 /* sp <- {qp, qsize} * {vp, vsize-qsize} */
1294 qp[0] ^= sticky3orig; /* restore original quotient */
1295 if (qsize >= k)
1296 mpn_mul (sp, qp, qsize, vp, k);
1297 else
1298 mpn_mul (sp, vp, k, qp, qsize);
1299 if (qh)
1300 qh2 = mpn_add_n (sp + qsize, sp + qsize, vp, k);
1301 else
1302 qh2 = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
1303 qp[0] ^= sticky3orig; /* restore truncated quotient */
1304
1305 /* compare qh2 + {sp, k + qsize} to {ap, qsize} + low(u) */
1306 cmp_s_r = (qh2 != 0) ? 1 : mpn_cmp (sp + k, ap, qsize);
1307 if (cmp_s_r == 0) /* compare {sp, k} and low(u) */
1308 {
1309 cmp_s_r = (usize >= qqsize) ?
1310 mpfr_mpn_cmp_aux (sp, k, up, usize - qqsize, extra_bit) :
1311 mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (sp, k);
1312 }
1313 /* now cmp_s_r > 0 if {sp, vsize} > {ap, qsize} + low(u)
1314 cmp_s_r = 0 if {sp, vsize} = {ap, qsize} + low(u)
1315 cmp_s_r < 0 if {sp, vsize} < {ap, qsize} + low(u) */
1316 if (cmp_s_r <= 0) /* quotient is in [q1, q1+1) */
1317 {
1318 sticky = (cmp_s_r == 0) ? sticky3 : MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
1319 goto case_1;
1320 }
1321 else /* cmp_s_r > 0, quotient is < q1: to determine if it is
1322 in [q1-2,q1-1] or in [q1-1,q1], we need to subtract
1323 the low part u0 of the dividend u0 from q*v0 */
1324 {
1325 mp_limb_t cy = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
1326
1327 /* subtract low(u)>>extra_bit if non-zero */
1328 if (qh2 != 0) /* whatever the value of {up, m + k}, it
1329 will be smaller than qh2 + {sp, k} */
1330 cmp_s_r = 1;
1331 else
1332 {
1333 if (low_u != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1334 {
1335 mp_size_t m;
1336 l = usize - qqsize; /* number of low limbs in u */
1337 m = (l > k) ? l - k : 0;
1338 cy = (extra_bit) ?
1339 (up[m] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE) : MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
1340 if (l >= k) /* u0 has more limbs than s:
1341 first look if {up, m} is not zero,
1342 and compare {sp, k} and {up + m, k} */
1343 {
1344 cy = cy || mpfr_mpn_cmpzero (up, m);
1345 low_u = cy;
1346 cy = mpfr_mpn_sub_aux (sp, up + m, k,
1347 cy, extra_bit);
1348 }
1349 else /* l < k: s has more limbs than u0 */
1350 {
1351 low_u = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
1352 if (cy != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1353 cy = mpn_sub_1 (sp + k - l - 1, sp + k - l - 1,
1354 1, MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT);
1355 cy = mpfr_mpn_sub_aux (sp + k - l, up, l,
1356 cy, extra_bit);
1357 }
1358 }
1359 MPFR_ASSERTD (cy <= 1);
1360 cy = mpn_sub_1 (sp + k, sp + k, qsize, cy);
1361 /* subtract r */
1362 cy += mpn_sub_n (sp + k, sp + k, ap, qsize);
1363 MPFR_ASSERTD (cy <= 1);
1364 /* now compare {sp, ssize} to v */
1365 cmp_s_r = mpn_cmp (sp, vp, vsize);
1366 if (cmp_s_r == 0 && low_u != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1367 cmp_s_r = 1; /* since in fact we subtracted
1368 less than 1 */
1369 }
1370 if (cmp_s_r <= 0) /* q1-1 <= u/v < q1 */
1371 {
1372 if (sticky3 == MPFR_LIMB_ONE)
1373 { /* q1-1 is either representable (directed rounding),
1374 or the middle of two numbers (nearest) */
1375 sticky = (cmp_s_r) ? MPFR_LIMB_ONE : MPFR_LIMB_ZERO;
1376 goto case_1;
1377 }
1378 /* now necessarily sticky3=0 */
1379 else if (round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1380 { /* round_bit=0, sticky3=0: q1-1 is exact only
1381 when sh=0 */
1382 inex = (cmp_s_r || sh) ? -1 : 0;
1383 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN ||
1384 (! like_rndz && inex != 0))
1385 {
1386 inex = 1;
1387 goto truncate_check_qh;
1388 }
1389 else /* round down */
1390 goto sub_one_ulp;
1391 }
1392 else /* sticky3=0, round_bit=1 ==> rounding to nearest */
1393 {
1394 inex = cmp_s_r;
1395 goto truncate;
1396 }
1397 }
1398 else /* q1-2 < u/v < q1-1 */
1399 {
1400 /* if rnd=MPFR_RNDN, the result is q1 when
1401 q1-2 >= q1-2^(sh-1), i.e. sh >= 2,
1402 otherwise (sh=1) it is q1-2 */
1403 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) /* sh > 0 */
1404 {
1405 /* Case sh=1: sb=0 always, and q1-rb is exactly
1406 representable, like q1-rb-2.
1407 rb action
1408 0 subtract two ulps, inex=-1
1409 1 truncate, inex=1
1410
1411 Case sh>1: one ulp is 2^(sh-1) >= 2
1412 rb sb action
1413 0 0 truncate, inex=1
1414 0 1 truncate, inex=1
1415 1 x truncate, inex=-1
1416 */
1417 if (sh == 1)
1418 {
1419 if (round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1420 {
1421 inex = -1;
1422 sh = 0;
1423 goto sub_two_ulp;
1424 }
1425 else
1426 {
1427 inex = 1;
1428 goto truncate_check_qh;
1429 }
1430 }
1431 else /* sh > 1 */
1432 {
1433 inex = (round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) ? 1 : -1;
1434 goto truncate_check_qh;
1435 }
1436 }
1437 else if (like_rndz)
1438 {
1439 /* the result is down(q1-2), i.e. subtract one
1440 ulp if sh > 0, and two ulps if sh=0 */
1441 inex = -1;
1442 if (sh > 0)
1443 goto sub_one_ulp;
1444 else
1445 goto sub_two_ulp;
1446 }
1447 /* if round away from zero, the result is up(q1-1),
1448 which is q1 unless sh = 0, where it is q1-1 */
1449 else
1450 {
1451 inex = 1;
1452 if (sh > 0)
1453 goto truncate_check_qh;
1454 else /* sh = 0 */
1455 goto sub_one_ulp;
1456 }
1457 }
1458 }
1459 }
1460 }
1461 }
1462
1463 case_1: /* quotient is in [q1, q1+1),
1464 round_bit is the round_bit (0 for directed rounding),
1465 sticky the sticky bit */
1466 if (like_rndz || (round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && sticky == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO))
1467 {
1468 inex = round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && sticky == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO ? 0 : -1;
1469 goto truncate;
1470 }
1471 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) /* sticky <> 0 or round <> 0 */
1472 {
1473 if (round_bit == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) /* necessarily sticky <> 0 */
1474 {
1475 inex = -1;
1476 goto truncate;
1477 }
1478 /* round_bit = 1 */
1479 else if (sticky != MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
1480 goto add_one_ulp; /* inex=1 */
1481 else /* round_bit=1, sticky=0 */
1482 goto even_rule;
1483 }
1484 else /* round away from zero, sticky <> 0 */
1485 goto add_one_ulp; /* with inex=1 */
1486
1487 sub_two_ulp:
1488 /* we cannot subtract MPFR_LIMB_MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh+1) since this is
1489 undefined for sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS */
1490 qh -= mpn_sub_1 (q0p, q0p, q0size, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
1491 /* go through */
1492
1493 sub_one_ulp:
1494 qh -= mpn_sub_1 (q0p, q0p, q0size, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh);
1495 /* go through truncate_check_qh */
1496
1497 truncate_check_qh:
1498 if (qh)
1499 {
1500 if (MPFR_LIKELY (qexp < MPFR_EXP_MAX))
1501 qexp ++;
1502 /* else qexp is now incorrect, but one will still get an overflow */
1503 q0p[q0size - 1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1504 }
1505 goto truncate;
1506
1507 even_rule: /* has to set inex */
1508 inex = (q0p[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) ? 1 : -1;
1509 if (inex < 0)
1510 goto truncate;
1511 /* else go through add_one_ulp */
1512
1513 add_one_ulp:
1514 inex = 1; /* always here */
1515 if (mpn_add_1 (q0p, q0p, q0size, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh))
1516 {
1517 if (MPFR_LIKELY (qexp < MPFR_EXP_MAX))
1518 qexp ++;
1519 /* else qexp is now incorrect, but one will still get an overflow */
1520 q0p[q0size - 1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
1521 }
1522
1523 truncate: /* inex already set */
1524
1525 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
1526
1527 /* check for underflow/overflow */
1528 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qexp > __gmpfr_emax))
1529 return mpfr_overflow (q, rnd_mode, sign_quotient);
1530 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(qexp < __gmpfr_emin))
1531 {
1532 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN && ((qexp < __gmpfr_emin - 1) ||
1533 (inex >= 0 && mpfr_powerof2_raw (q))))
1534 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
1535 return mpfr_underflow (q, rnd_mode, sign_quotient);
1536 }
1537 MPFR_SET_EXP(q, qexp);
1538
1539 inex *= sign_quotient;
1540 MPFR_RET (inex);
1541}
1542
